data.name: The Dutch National Flag Problem
data.description:
# The Dutch National Flag Problem

There is a row of balls, each ball is either red, white, or blue.

Your task is to rearrange (if necessary) the balls in the order of the Dutch national flag, i.e. first the red, then the white, and finally the blue balls.

You will receive a list of integer representing the row of balls and their colors:
- 0 for red
- 1 for white
- 2 for blue

## Examples (input -> output)

```
[1,2,0] -> [0,1,2]
[1,2,1,0] -> [0,1,1,2]
[1,2,2,0,2,1,1,0] -> [0,0,1,1,1,2,2,2]
```

Give it a shot without using buit in sorting functions :)

Proposed by [Edsger Dijkstra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edsger_Dijkstra) in his book [_A Discipline of Programming_](https://seriouscomputerist.atariverse.com/media/pdf/book/Discipline%20of%20Programming.pdf#page=126) Prentice-Hall, 1976
